Key Arguments: The legislation could stifle freedom of speech and punish dissenting opinions.
The government's handling of COVID-19, influenced by pharmaceutical companies, was flawed.
Lobbyists and large companies have too much influence over government decisions.
Any restrictions on speech should be extremely moderate and only apply in extreme cases.
Notable Quotes: This sounds like a way for the government to entrench their ability to stifle freedom of speech and punish anyone expressing a different opinion.
The covid debacle showed very clearly how the pharmaceutical companies brainwashed the government to use only their vaccine and disallow other early (better) treatments.
Legislation such as this is most likely a step in the wrong direction unless the covid debacle is recognised as the hazard to us that it was.
